page.title: 04GREENHEAD FARM
page.content: Blackfaced ewes breed three quarters of the required replacement stock for the farm. Th remaining stock are bought in to maintain a healthy gene pool. Gray faced ewes are kept for fat, all lambs are sold fat and ready for slaughter. Lambing starts around the first of April each ewe producing on average 1.8 lambs each year. Fifty suffolk lambbs are kept for bbreeding tups. They start lambing at the beginning of January. Many of the tups are sold at the Kelso sales. Ten off the ewe lambs are kept to replenish stock these are sold at five to six year old. Twentyfive acres of the land is covered in coniferous trees. The rest off the farm is twentyfour fields and four paddocks. Stock 800 Gray faced ewes, 200 Black faced ewes, 50 pure bred Suffolk
